meanings.definition: To focus all one's attention or mental effort on a particular object or activity.
meanings.sent1: She was concentrating on solving the math problem.
meanings.sent2: The students were concentrating during the important lecture.
meanings.sent3: The cat was concentrating so hard on catching the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a laser beam, concentrating on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: He closed his eyes, concentrating deeply to remember the lyrics.

meanings.definition: To bring all elements or parts together in a common center.
meanings.sent1: The chef was concentrating the flavors in the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The artist was concentrating the colors in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The team was concentrating their efforts to win the game.
meanings.sent4: The tornado was like a giant vacuum, concentrating everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The magnet was concentrating the metal filings around it.

meanings.definition: To increase the strength or purity of a substance by removing or reducing diluting agents.
meanings.sent1: The distillation process was concentrating the alcohol in the solution.
meanings.sent2: The purification method was concentrating the gold in the ore.
meanings.sent3: The experiment went wrong when the scientist was concentrating the chemicals.
meanings.sent4: The sun was like a giant lens, concentrating its rays on the solar panel.
meanings.sent5: The filter was concentrating the impurities in the water.
